name: Bishop's Lodge Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel despite the mixed bag of reviews on this site and felt it was fine for our needs. We got a good rate staying 2 nights in a Superior Deluxe King on the Santa Fe 400th 2 night package with breakfast for two and resort fee included (I hate paying resort fees, since I think they are ridiculous when you usually have to pay and tip for amenities separately anyways). So to have them waived was a plus. We had previously stayed 3 nights in a downtown Santa Fe Inn and decided to stay 2 nights at Bishops Lodge to do some horse back riding through their stables. We enjoyed the horse back riding - Jeff the guide was very nice and very easy on the eyes:)!
reviews.title: Decent hotel...doesn't feel like a resort though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was up the hill towards the back of the property and was very nice. It was a little complicated to find especially at night and I would not want to walk from the room to the restaurant in the dark.
reviews.title: They should be sued for false advertising!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since the Bishops Lodge is in a quiet residential area, there really aren't any restaurants nearby without having to drive. As a result we at at the hotel both nights. The dining room was on the pricey side so we ate outside on the terrace from their smaller bar menu. The food was very good on both evenings and there was plenty of choice with good size portions. The service on our first night was very good, but on the second night we ate a little later (after our horseback ride) after most other guests had already dined, and therefore the service was not as good. Our server wasn't very friendly nor attentive. There was a fire in the kiva, but when we ran out of logs the staff couldn't locate any more. Disappointing since at this point it had gotten a little chilly. Breakfast was included in our rate and it was just average.
reviews.title: If I had only read Tripadvisor before we booked this hotel!

reviews.text: We sat by the pool one afternoon, but the water was too cold to swim in. Besides that there were lots of bees/wasps in the water. The hot tub is in a strange walled off area and is not very attractive. All you see are the cement walls around you. I don't know why they did not have the hot tub in the open like the pool. The grounds and landscaping on the property are very nice. There is a small chapel which I think would be lovely for a small wedding.
reviews.title: Great Getaway Weekend
Secluded!
reviews.text: Nice place to stay, but I think you need to splurge for an upgraded room. Most of the negative comments on this site focused on the standard rooms. I didn't see those, so can't speak to their quality. This was a decent hotel, but just didn't feel like a resort.

Bishop's Lodge is located on a mountainside just outside of Santa Fe. The locale is beautiful but parking is tight by the room that we were assigned. We had afternoon showers that cooled things down for us and we did not mind watching the storms flow in over the mountain. July is monsoon season so with that said, we felt lucky to have just a few showers and no real MONSOONS!
reviews.title: Lovely Getaway!

reviews.text: The 2 bedroom suite was large with a fireplace to boot! But the place needed to be remodeled as the floors were uneven and fixtures in the bathrooms were leaky. Furnishing were of the rustic santa fe feel and were adequate and comfortable.
reviews.title: The lodge that time forgot-Avoid this place-Worst value anywhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely bring the family there again.
reviews.title: Extreamley Attentive

reviews.text: I hesitate to completely trash anyplace in a review, but this is the place that deserves a complete trashing. I have traveled over a large part of the globe in my life, and never have I felt that I received less value for my money than at the Bishop's Lodge. Understand that this is not a moderately priced hotel, and they try and squeeze every nickel they can out of you while giving nothing in return. I understand this lodge is over 90 years old, but that does not mean it needs to be rundown and dirty. I do not kid you when I tell you that in the main lodge it looks like they still have the original carpet, it might have been cleaned 75 years ago though. I arrived with several people, and we received room scattered all over the property. There was a large difference in accommodations depending on what part of the grounds you stayed, but none were acceptable or worth the price, the only question was how badly you were ripped off and gouged. The older lodges are dirty, dingy, smell awful, and are worse than any Motel 6 or Super 8 room for 5x the price. The hallways in the old lodge smelled like a mixture of skunks, mildew and death. The "newer" rooms are much larger, and look great upon arrival, but when you stay there and start to notice the small details you see the lack of upkeep there as well. Stained carpets, holes in the carpet, TV from 1982, stained sheets, pubic hair in the corner of the bathroom, worn & or broken furniture. Far from luxury accommodations. The staff is a mixed bag, some very nice people that try hard, and some nasty young folks that emanate anger. They offer a free shuttle downtown by the angriest snotty young man I have ever had the misfortune of being locked in a vehicle with. On top of the outrageous prices for the feeble accommodations they hit you with about a $15.00 per day per person resort fee! So for a family of 4 it is about $60 extra per day for very little in return. When I questioned the fee the desk manager stressed that this fee included free parking! I had to park no where near my original smelly dungeon of a room, and never have I paid for parking at a facility miles outside the city limits. Room service menu claims service until 11pm, until you call at 10pm and are informed that it actually stops at 9pm! I could easily go on about the disappointments in this lodge all day, but I imagine that I made my point, no wonder they charge a $50.00 early departure fee, I am certain they see early departures all the time. In summary, if you are looking for a restaurant that smells like gas and old socks, a room in the summer in NM with no AC, service charges and fee's of every variety added to everything and everything, than this is the place for you. It is a shame. It is a great location, and I could only imagine how magnificent this place could have been at one point in history.
reviews.title: Friendly but clueless staff and antiquated amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at Bishop's Lodge was extreamely attentive. I would recommend for any occassion.
reviews.title: A Very Magical Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been reading all the nightmare-ish reviews of the rooms at Bishops Lodge and was pleasantly surprised. Our room was extra-large - with a second room with bunk-beds and another TV. The king bed in the main room was quite comfortable and the bathroom was large and clean. The room certainly was dated.....1970s, but was in decent condition with wi-fi and a good air conditioner and TV. The grounds and overall location were gorgeous. The original Bishop retreat house and chapel is a must see. The dining room and bar and patio area was just spectacular - it felt like you were in a 1930's Santa Fe oil painting. The service including a personal talk with the manager was outstanding. Every request we had was handled promptly. The drive to the plaza was truly only minutes. Overall a very pleasant and beautiful place to stay. You will not get a 5 star brand new luxury room here, but what you get is something quite special in a setting that cannot be beat....
reviews.title: Beautiful setting and extra large room.....

reviews.text: When we arrived at 4PM our room was not ready and we had to wait by the pool. When we finally got our room it was disgusting-like something out of the 70's overlooking dumpsters. About an hour later the front desk called and asked if I liked my room. My answer was no so they moved me to another room. This room also looked like something out of the 80's and was stained and dirty. The shower was nasty. It is a shame the rooms are so bad because the setting is lovely. My daughter went horseback riding which she enjoyed. We had dinner and one breakfast and the food was ok-nothing special.
reviews.title: Horrible rooms, beautiful setting
What out for the "deluxe suite" that's not so deluxe
reviews.text: My wife and I and two boys stayed at Bishops Lodge to three days. We ended up being put into a really old part of the resort, which would be fine if it was historic old but it rundown old. The floor was uneven, the doors didn't shut, the faucets leaked, the bed was uncomfortable. No WIFI in the the room.

Other than the room, the rest of the resort is awesome. The restaurant is good, the pool is nice, the spa great, the hiking trails and other activities were fun. The service was good, everyone was very friendly. And the location is perfect, just outside of town, with nice views of the mountains.
reviews.title: great hotel, wonderful spa
Much to recommend it - but it could use some investment
reviews.text: If you get one of the newer rooms, I think you will enjoy your stay more. By the way, just because it's called a deluxe suite and the picture on the web site looks clean and beautiful, doesn't mean you'll get what you think. Our crappy old room was called a "deluxe suite".

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and i recently stayed at Bishop's Lodge in a one bedroom suite. Location just a 5 minute drive out of town was quite nice. As we approached the property it actually looked like a beautiful resort. Little clusters of adobe style rooms built into the hills. However, when we arrived at our one bedroom suite it wasn't so sweet. The building is in a terrible state of disrepair with cracked and missing bricks leading up the stairway. Upon entering we found the following: cracked fireplace, old, dirty and lumpy carpets, mold in bathroom, broken toilet, holes in screen, no sound insulation from neighboring rooms. Old mattresses, and a large chunk of cement broken off next to lock on door leaving a huge hole in wall. In general, the furnishings made us feel like we were staying in a musty storage room instead of an upscale guest room. The list goes on but why bother with more of the details. Better off saving your money and staying at the classier Motel 6. One final note: Rick Veruni (the general manager) responded by phone to our written complaints. When he tried to apologize and ask what he could do for us I responded by asking to be compensated in some way. His response was "I think it's just nice of me that I even called you". He said that twice and then the conversation ended. After reading other reviews on trip advisor I was leary about staying there, but since our friends were staying there we thought how bad could it be. The answer is VERY BAD!!!!
reviews.title: Suites NOT so sweet.

reviews.text: My friend and I enjoyed a relaxing stay at this historic lodge located about 2 miles from downtown Santa Fe. Though we spent little time at the hotel, we did enjoy the lovely pool, hiking trails and a delicious breakfast buffet. Service levels were inconsistent.Shuttle drivers were charming yet the young woman at the front desk appeared perturbed whenever she was asked questions by guests. The "free" shuttle runs only 3x daily; the hotel charges $14 roundtrip otherwise. We hired a local driver with far better rates (Laurence Longwell - [--- --- ---])
reviews.title: Lovely setting, spacious rooms, inconsistent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: great position, great position, pretty rooms but service qualty is not the same level from food quality to precision and attention; a bit expensive for the overall experience
reviews.title: great structure, inadequate service level

reviews.text: The best things about this hotel are its grounds and the proximity to Santa Fe's downtown. The hotel sits just minutes outside of Santa Fe in really beautiful hills, but it is very dated, even rustic. It needs a lot of updating. My room had some charm with exposed beams in the ceiling, but the carpet was stained and the decor was just outdated overall. Worse than the room was the service of the staff. It literally took three conversations and two days for my room service tray to be removed. I'll never understand why. Also, beware of the photos on the hotel's website. They paint a rosy picture. The most deceptive is a photo of the outdoor massage, which in reality takes place under a rickety canopy right next to the tennis court. The tennis lesson going on during my massage was so distracting we had to move my massage session inside. It was unacceptable! I wouldn't stay here again.
reviews.title: Beautiful location, but just a place to dump your luggage

reviews.text: We stayed here as members of a wedding party that was having the reception at Bishops Lodge. It was a complete nightmare. We constantly fought with the hotel staff on things they "forgot" to do. Booking a couple of hours at the spa for the bride and her friends was nearly impossible. They would confirm services then turn around a week later and say they couldn't or would not provide the services. We could never get a straight answer.
reviews.title: Terrible Customer Service - left feeling scammed

description: In August of 1851, a Frenchman, Jean Baptiste Lamy, arrived in the NM Territory as the first Bishop of Santa Fe. Here he built a private retreat; his chapel still stands today, now on the national register of historic places. After Lamy's Death, the land was acquired by the Pulitzer publishing family as a private vacation retreat. In 1917, the Thorpe family from Denver fell in love with these pristine acres, bought the property and developed the first resort in the state. Today Bishop's Lodge comprises 15 lodges for a total of 110 rooms ranging in sizes from 250 sq feet to 450, not to mention a 2000 sq foot Presidential Suite. Many of our rooms feature fireplaces and the majority all have outdoor access to patios, lawns or balconies. Our ShaNah Spa and Wellness Center which opened up in June of 2002 is a sanctuary where one can take time out to be nurtured by Mother Nature, guided by ancient wisdon and touched by angels. The experience may change your life. Other activities are abundant such as: trap/skeet shooting (offered to groups of 10 or monmre roomnights), horseback, pony trail rides, hiking, mountain biking, fitness center, excercise studio, outdoor pool, whirlpool and tennis to mention a few. Bishop's Lodge is located just 3 miles from the Historic Santa Fe Plaza. Complimentary shuttle service is provided by the lodge at scheduled times daily.
